meanings.definition: relating to the holding of property or an office
meanings.sent1: The tenurial agreement ensured that the land would be well taken care of.
meanings.sent2: Her tenurial rights as the office manager were clearly defined in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The tenurial responsibilities of the property owner included keeping the garden gnome happy.
meanings.sent4: His tenurial commitment to the position was as solid as the foundation of the building.
meanings.sent5: The tenurial duties required attention to detail and dedication.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the conditions under which something is held or maintained
meanings.sent1: The tenurial terms of the lease agreement were favorable to the tenant.
meanings.sent2: The tenurial arrangement for the maintenance of the equipment was well organized.
meanings.sent3: The tenurial rules for the pet hamster's cage were surprisingly strict.
meanings.sent4: In the tenurial grip of winter, the garden struggled to survive.
meanings.sent5: The tenurial conditions of the contract were clearly outlined for all parties involved.
